H0.text: The planet to revolve once around the Sun is the event that defines a year, which is a little over 365 days for Earth.

H1.text: The seasons completing a full cycle is the time it takes for a planetâ€™s year, which on Earth is a little over 365 days.

H2.text: The planet to rotate once on its axis is the time it takes for the length of a year on a planet, which on Earth is a little over 365 days.

H3.text: The Sun to rotate once on its axis is the time it takes for the length of a year on a planet.

A4.text: The orbital period (also revolution period) is the amount of time a given astronomical object takes to complete one orbit around another object.

A5.text: The tropical period of Earth (a tropical year) is the interval between two alignments of its rotational axis with the Sun, also viewed as two passages of the object at a right ascension of 0 hr.
